00023 #ifndef __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NAIVE_METHOD_HPP
00024 #define __MLPACK_METHODS_KERNEL_PCA_NAIVE_METHOD_HPP
00025 
00026 #include <mlpack/core.hpp>
00027 
00028 namespace mlpack {
00029 namespace kpca {
00030 
00031 template<typename KernelType>
00032 class NaiveKernelRule
00033 {
00034  public:
00035   public:
00046     static void ApplyKernelMatrix(const arma::mat& data,
00047                                   arma::mat& transformedData,
00048                                   arma::vec& eigval,
00049                                   arma::mat& eigvec,
00050                                   const size_t /* unused */,
00051                                   KernelType kernel = KernelType())
00052   {
00053     // Construct the kernel matrix.
00054     arma::mat kernelMatrix;
00055     // Resize the kernel matrix to the right size.
00056     kernelMatrix.set_size(data.n_cols, data.n_cols);
00057 
00058     // Note that we only need to calculate the upper triangular part of the 
00059     // kernel matrix, since it is symmetric. This helps minimize the number of
00060     // kernel evaluations.
00061     for (size_t i = 0; i < data.n_cols; ++i)
00062     {
00063       for (size_t j = i; j < data.n_cols; ++j)
00064       {
00065         // Evaluate the kernel on these two points.
00066         kernelMatrix(i, j) = kernel.Evaluate(data.unsafe_col(i),
00067                                              data.unsafe_col(j));
00068       }
00069     }
00070 
00071     // Copy to the lower triangular part of the matrix.
00072     for (size_t i = 1; i < data.n_cols; ++i)
00073       for (size_t j = 0; j < i; ++j)
00074         kernelMatrix(i, j) = kernelMatrix(j, i);
00075 
00076     // For PCA the data has to be centered, even if the data is centered. But it
00077     // is not guaranteed that the data, when mapped to the kernel space, is also
00078     // centered. Since we actually never work in the feature space we cannot
00079     // center the data. So, we perform a "psuedo-centering" using the kernel
00080     // matrix.
00081     arma::rowvec rowMean = arma::sum(kernelMatrix, 0) / kernelMatrix.n_cols;
00082     kernelMatrix.each_col() -= arma::sum(kernelMatrix, 1) / kernelMatrix.n_cols;
00083     kernelMatrix.each_row() -= rowMean;
00084     kernelMatrix += arma::sum(rowMean) / kernelMatrix.n_cols;
00085 
00086     // Eigendecompose the centered kernel matrix.
00087     arma::eig_sym(eigval, eigvec, kernelMatrix);
00088 
00089     // Swap the eigenvalues since they are ordered backwards (we need largest to
00090     // smallest).
00091     for (size_t i = 0; i < floor(eigval.n_elem / 2.0); ++i)
00092       eigval.swap_rows(i, (eigval.n_elem - 1) - i);
00093 
00094     // Flip the coefficients to produce the same effect.
00095     eigvec = arma::fliplr(eigvec);
00096 
00097     transformedData = eigvec.t() * kernelMatrix;
00098   }
00099 };
00100 
00101 }; // namespace kpca
00102 }; // namespace mlpack
00103 
00104 #endif
